revised_title: Effect of Longitudinal Magnetic Field on Internal Viscosity of Wires of Nickel and Iron
tldr: The authors investigate the effect of a longitudinal magnetic field on the internal viscosity of iron and nickel wires by observing the rate of subsidence of torsional oscillations. They find that the rate of subsidence decreases with increasing magnetizing force in iron wires and increases initially before decreasing with further increase in magnetizing force in nickel wires.
